definitions.definition: The front part of the head of a human or other animal , featuring the eyes , nose , and mouth , and the surrounding area.
examples: That girl has a pretty face .
The monkey pressed its face against the railings.
Why the sad face ?

subdefinitions.definition: A distorted facial expression ; an expression of displeasure , insult , etc.
examples: Children! Stop making faces at each other!
labels: in expressions such as ' make a face '
subdefinitions.label_groups: in expressions such as ' make a face '

subdefinitions.definition: The amount expressed on a bill , note , bond , etc., without any interest or discount ; face value .
A headlining wrestler with a persona embodying heroic or virtuous traits and who is regarded as a " good guy ", especially one who is handsome and well - conditioned ; a baby face .
examples: The fans cheered on the face as he made his comeback.
Shut your face !
He's always stuffing his face with chips.

subdefinitions.definition: Makeup ; one's complete facial cosmetic application .
examples: I'll be out in a sec. Just let me put on my face .
Our chairman is the face of this company.
He managed to show a bold face despite his embarrassment.

subdefinitions.definition: Good reputation ; standing , in the eyes of others; dignity ; prestige .

examples: You've got some face coming round here after what you've done.

subdefinitions.definition: An aspect of the character or nature of someone or something.
examples: This is a face of her that we have not seen before.
Poverty is the ugly face of capitalism.
to fly in the face of danger
to speak before the face of God

subdefinitions.definition: A person ; the self ; ( reflexively , objectifying ) oneself .
examples: It was just the usual faces at the pub tonight.
He better not show his face around here no more.

subdefinitions.definition: A familiar or well-known person; a member of a particular scene , such as the music or fashion scene.
examples: He owned several local businesses and was a face around town.
The face of the cliff loomed above them.

subdefinitions.definition: The numbered dial of a clock or watch ; the clock face .

examples: They turned the boat into the face of the storm.

definitions.definition: Any surface , especially a front or outer one.
examples: Put a big sign on each face of the building that can be seen from the road.
They climbed the north face of the mountain.
She wanted to wipe him off the face of the earth.

definitions.definition: Any of the flat bounding surfaces of a polyhedron ; more generally, any of the bounding pieces of a polytope of any dimension .
examples: A cube has six faces , each of which is a square.

definitions.definition: The front surface of a bat .
The part of a golf club that hits the ball .
The head of a lion , shown face-on and cut off immediately behind the ears .
The side of the card that shows its value (as opposed to the back side, which looks the same on all cards of the deck ).
The player character , especially as opposed to minions or other entities which might absorb damage instead of the player character.
examples: When playing aggro decks, hit face whenever you can; it's not worth spending your resources to try to control the board .

definitions.definition: The width of a pulley , or the length of a cog from end to end.
examples: a pulley or cog wheel of ten inches face

definitions.definition: The exposed surface of the mineral deposit where it is being mined. Also the exposed end surface of a tunnel where digging may still be in progress.
A mode of regard , whether favourable or unfavourable ; favour or anger .

main_definition: ( anatomy ) The front part of the head of a human or other animal , featuring the eyes , nose , and mouth , and the surrounding area.
secondary_definitions: Any surface , especially a front or outer one.
( geometry ) Any of the flat bounding surfaces of a polyhedron ; more generally, any of the bounding pieces of a polytope of any dimension .
( cricket ) The front surface of a bat .
( golf ) The part of a golf club that hits the ball .
( heraldry ) The head of a lion , shown face-on and cut off immediately behind the ears .
( card games ) The side of the card that shows its value (as opposed to the back side, which looks the same on all cards of the deck ).
( video games , TCGs , uncountable ) The player character , especially as opposed to minions or other entities which might absorb damage instead of the player character.
( mechanics ) The width of a pulley , or the length of a cog from end to end.
( mining ) The exposed surface of the mineral deposit where it is being mined. Also the exposed end surface of a tunnel where digging may still be in progress.
A mode of regard , whether favourable or unfavourable ; favour or anger .
